CLISH_MODULE:
<COMMAND name="show Radius-Settings" help="Display radius configuration.
A RADIUS server maintains a database of user accounts used in larger environments. If a RADIUS server already exists, it can be used for authenticating users that want to connect to the wireless network provided by this device. When multiple RADIUS servers are configured they are accessed in the same order as in the table. If first RADIUS server is not accessible, then system tries to contact the next RADIUS server.
Configured Radius Servers This table displays the list of all configured RADIUS servers. If the optional argument is specified, detailed configuration of the RADIUS server is displayed.
: IP address of RADIUS authentication server
: IP address of RADIUS accounting server
: RADIUS authentication server port to send the RADIUS messages.
: The time (in seconds) the device waits for a response from the RADIUS server
: The number of tries the router will make to the RADIUS server before giving up.
: RADIUS server secret. This field is only displayed if the argument is specified.
"> lua clishCmdExec(radiusGet)
lua clishCmdExec(serverStatusGetRadius, "Radius", "radiusClient")
<COMMAND name="show Radius-Accounting-Server-Settings" help="Display radius accounting server configuration.
A RADIUS server maintains a database of user accounts used in larger environments. If a RADIUS accounting server already exists, it can be used for accounting traffic in a session maintained by this device. When multiple RADIUS servers are configured they are accessed in the same order as in the table. If first RADIUS accounting server is not accessible, then system tries to contact the next RADIUS accounting server.
Configured Radius Accounting Servers This table displays the list of all configured RADIUS accounting servers.
: IP address of RADIUS accounting server
: RADIUS accounting server port to send the RADIUS messages.
: RADIUS server secret.
" check_supported="Y"> lua clishCmdExec(radiusAccGet)
lua clishCmdExec (servicesRouteGetAll)
